title: Ban on two-wheeled food delivery vehicles gets cold reception in City Council
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News The city is taking some measures to crack down on the vehicles, but support for an outright ban appears thin.
Police investigate a crash between a pedestrian and an e-bike delivery driver in front of the Boston Public Library in August 2025.

Lane Turner/Boston Globe Members of the Boston City Council are beginning to debate the potential ban of mopeds, scooters and other similar vehicles from being used by third-party food delivery drivers.

title: As playoff race tightens, Red Sox desperately need Alex Bregman’s bat to wake up
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Red Sox "There's nothing that can kind of prepare you for playing in this type of environment this late in the season, for what's at stake.
" Alex Bregman has struggled to find his game down the stretch.

(Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff) By Conor Ryan September 18, 2025 | 6:21 AM 4 minutes to read When the Red Sox crafted a three-year, $120 million contract to Alex Bregman in February, the expectation was that the two-time World Series champion’s veteran mettle would pay dividends for a roster yearning for October baseball.

title: 5 can’t-miss restaurant openings and dining updates in Boston this week
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Food Stay up to date on the best new restaurants, recent openings, and the biggest dining updates across Greater Boston's food scene.
89 Charles, a new cocktail bar in Beacon Hill, opens in September.
Courtesy of 89 Charles ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Drake Maye backs up DeMario Douglas amid decreased role in Patriots offense
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots “Just stay bringing it.
I think that the ball is going to find him.
" DeMario Douglas has reeled in three catches through two games for New England.

title: Man found guilty of raping teenage girl at Rockland migrant shelter in 2024
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime The man was convicted on one count of child rape aggravated by an age gap of 10 years or more, according to court records.
Cory Alvarez, 27, was found guilty of raping a 15-year-old girl at a Rockland migrant shelter in 2024.
David L Ryan/The Boston Globe A man was found guilty Friday of raping a teenage girl in March 2024 at a Rockland hotel that was being used as an emergency shelter for migrants.

title: Brad Marchand reveals ‘main reason’ why his contract talks with Bruins broke down
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins "I want to play until I get kicked out of the league.
” Brad Marchand signed a six-year deal with the Panthers this offseason.
AP Photo/Lynne Sladky By Conor Ryan September 17, 2025 2 minutes to read In a perfect world, Brad Marchand would still be in Boston and holding court as the Bruins’ captain this fall.

title: 2 Framingham police officers on leave amid ‘misconduct’ investigation
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News The two officers are on paid administrative leave, the department said.
The issues “under review involve potential health and wellness concerns.
” The Framingham Police Department put two of its officers on leave amid an internal investigation into alleged “misconduct,” Chief Lester Baker announced Monday.

title: Lockdown lifted at Fall River high school after bomb, gun threat deemed a hoax
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News A caller reported that they were in one of the school bathrooms with a bomb and an AK-47 assault rifle, according to police.
A Fall River high school was placed into lockdown Wednesday after a reported threat which now appears to be a hoax, according to police.

Officers responded that morning to Diman Regional Vocational Technical High School after a caller reported that they were in one of the school bathrooms and had a bomb and an AK-47 assault rifle, Fall River police said on Facebook.

title: Drake Maye credits Aaron Rodgers for developing key aspect of his QB game
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "He’s very talented throwing the football, and I think he’s got some swagger to him.
" Drake Maye is set to battle against Aaron Rodgers in Week 3.
John Tlumacki/Boston Globe By Conor Ryan September 17, 2025 3 minutes to read Drake Maye has not shied away from sharing his affinity for Steelers QB Aaron Rodgers over the years.

title: Mass. releases COVID-19 vaccine guidance day before CDC vaccine meeting
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News Children between six months and 23 months "should receive" the vaccine, while healthy children and healthy adults "may receive" the shot, according to Mass.
health officials.
FILE - Pharmacist Kenni Clark injects Robert Champion, of Lawrence, Mass.
